repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: The personal papers of Dr. Rubinow who was active in the movement for social security from a medical point of view. He was also an economist and served in that capacity with th U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistices, the American Medical Association, and several Jewish welfare societies, including Bnai B'rith. The collection is composed of his correspondence, some of his articles and manuscripts.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: 1898 New York University Medical College, M.D.
1907 Economic Expert, Bureau of Statistics, U.S. Department of Agriculture
1907-08 Member, Bureau of Labor Statistics, U.S. Department of Commerce & Labor
1911-16 Chief Statistician, Ocean Accident and Guarantee Corporation
1916-17 Executive Secretary, American Medical Association, Social Insurance Commission
1917 Director, New York City Department of Public Charities, Bureau of Labor Statistics
1919-23 In Charge of American Zionist Medical Unit (renamed Hadassah Medical Organization)
1923-28 Director, Jewish Welfare Society of Philadelphia
1932- 33 President, National Conference of Jewish Social Service
1936 September, Died at the age of 61

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Isaac Max Rubinow Papers #5616. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Letters from Kozmin, a professor and editor of Struggling Journal "Russian Miller" - about publ.

scopecontent.p: Packet letters from Katzen, who appears to be involved with the Russian Social Democratic Society of Baltimore. First letter to Rubinov mentions a program in Kishinyov, and calls on him to uphold "the organization" by giving a lecture. - More of the same.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description of a reading-room in a Russian provincial city.

scopecontent.p: Questions about American universities. Stamped by the police from Kiyachko date illegible.

scopecontent.p: From Kiyachko, who is now in jail. Asks for a Harvard University Catalogue also two postcards.

scopecontent.p: From editor of "Courier".

scopecontent.p: A fan letter from Smolensk. 1905.
